image.altText: Two Tasmania Police officers stand next to a patrol car.

props.synopsis: In Tasmania, prosecutors must prove that children aged 10 to 14 who have committed crimes have an understanding of the moral wrongfulness of their actions, but the Liberals say they will look at instead requiring defence lawyers to prove their clients do not have this understanding.
